gameEngine

Class GameEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • gameEngine.GameEngine

  • public class GameEngine
extends java.lang.Object
    Framework for LevelGame.
    Author:
    Mark Baldwin, Cyndi Rader

    • Field Summary

    • Field Detail

      • BOARD_SIZE

        public static final int BOARD_SIZE
        Determines the size of the game board. Board is a 1D structure. It is an odd number so player can start exactly in the middle if desired.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • NUM_LEVELS

        public static final int NUM_LEVELS
        Number of levels defined for this game. GameEngine will automatically play each level, starting with 1 through the number specified here.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameEngine

        public GameEngine()
        Constructor for GameEngine. It creates a new LevelEngine

    • Method Detail

      • setupLevel

        public void setupLevel(int levelNum)
        Should be called at the beginning of every level (including beginning of program) to set up the data for that level.
        Parameters:
        levelNum - The number of the level to be loaded. Level number should be from 1 to GameEngine.NUM_LEVELS

      • displayBoard

        public void displayBoard()
        Prints a representation of the board. A null represents an empty space (drawn as just a space). All other objects must be Drawable, so that the draw method can be used.

      • movePieces

        public void movePieces()
        Calls the move method for each Moveable piece. All Moveable pieces should be placed in the movingPieces list. Pieces will move at the end of the level (after user has selected option, to prepare for the next level).

      • interaction

        public void interaction()
        Calls the interact method for each interactingPiece (i.e., GamePiece) All interacting pieces should be placed in the interactingPieces list. GameEngine will display a message and take the appropriate action based on the InteractionResult (e.g., sets player status to DEAD if the result is InteractionResult.KILL).

      • levelFinished

        public boolean levelFinished()
        Determines if this level is complete. Will be complete if player is advancing (either by interaction with a game piece or accumulating points) or dead (either by interaction with a game piece or accumulating too many hits).
        Returns:
        true if player advances or was killed, false otherwise

      • doOneLevel

        public void doOneLevel()
        Completes the game play for one level. During each round, the board is displayed, the player enters a movement option, the player's location is updated, then the player interacts with any pieces in the interactingPieces list. Moveable piece locations are then updated for the next round. This continues until the level is finished.

      • playGame

        public void playGame()
        Plays the game. Continues until either all levels have been completed or the player has been killed. Program exits when game is over.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Driver for the game. Creates game and plays it.
        Parameters:
        args - Unused
